title: Lynda - Foundations of IT Security: Operating System Security
description:

This Course will be good to the Best for DL within 30 days after has been post, after that it might not be good DL already, please do me favour to continue seeding to keep this torrent alive.

1h 23m Beginner Oct 15, 2015 | Uploaded in Nov 29, 2015 by 2boweb

Subject: IT 
Software: Windows Server Security 
Author: Lisa Bock 

The operating system is where many attacks are targeted, which makes OS-level security just as important to your organization as network security. OS security is a key component of the Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA) Security Fundamentals exam (98-367). In this course, Foundations of IT Security series creator Lisa Bock will also review user authentication, assigning permissions and Active Directory, along with creating audit policies, and how you can protect servers and email.â€¨â€¨Note: This training maps to a number of the exam topics on the Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA) Security Fundamentals exam (98-367). See https://www.microsoft.com/learning/en-us/exam-98-367.aspx for more information.
Topics include:
	â€¢	Creating strong passwords
	â€¢	Understanding biometric security
	â€¢	Adjusting permission behavior
	â€¢	Enabling auditing
	â€¢	OS hardening
	â€¢	Using the Microsoft Baseline Security Analyzer
	â€¢	Protecting email
